intro: Douglasia laevigata, commonly known as the smooth Douglasia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, contributing to its common name. Douglasia laevigata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
